intro: Eriocaulon woodsonianum, commonly known as the Woodson’s spike-moss, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Eriocaulaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant has slender, grass-like stems that bear small, clustered spikelets at the nodes. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. Eriocaulon woodsonianum thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in wetlands or along stream banks.
